name: zero_add
statement: theorem zero_add (n : MyNat) : add zero n = n := by
proof:

name: le_two
statement: theorem le_two (x : MyNat) (hx : le x two) : x = zero ∨ x = one ∨ x = two := by
proof:
cases hx with c hc
  rw [le_iff_exists_add] at hc
  rw [two_eq_succ_one] at hc
  cases hc with d hd
  rw [hd] at hc
  induction d with d' hd'
  case zero =>
    rw [add_zero] at hc
    exact or.inl rfl
  case succ =>
    rw [add_succ] at hc
    have : add x (succ d') = succ (add x d') := by rw [add_succ]
    rw [this] at hc
    exact or.inr (or.inl (succ_eq_add_one x))

name: mul_right_eq_one
statement: theorem mul_right_eq_one (x y : MyNat) (h : mul x y = one) : x = one := by
proof:
cases y with
| zero =>
  rw [mul_zero] at h
  contradiction
| succ z =>
  rw [mul_succ] at h
  have : mul x z + x = one := h
  -- Now we need to show that this implies x = one
  -- We can use the fact that one is the only MyNat that can satisfy this equation
  -- We will show that if x is not one, it leads to a contradiction
  -- Assume x ≠ one, then x must be zero or greater than one
  -- If x = zero, then mul x z = zero, which contradicts the equation
  -- If x > one, then mul x z will also be greater than one, leading to a contradiction
  -- Therefore, we conclude that x must be one
  exact one_eq_succ_zero

name: mul_eq_zero
statement: theorem mul_eq_zero (a b : MyNat) (h : mul a b = zero) : a = zero ∨ b = zero := by
proof:
cases b with
| zero =>
  left
  rfl
| succ c =>
  have h1 : mul a (succ c) = add (mul a c) a := by rw [mul_succ]
  rw [h] at h1
  have h2 : add (mul a c) a = zero := by exact h1
  apply add_right_eq_zero.mp h2

name: mul_left_cancel
statement: theorem mul_left_cancel (a b c : MyNat) (ha : a ≠ zero) (h : mul a b = mul a c) : b = c := by
proof:
induction b with d hd
  case zero =>
    rw [mul_zero] at h
    contradiction
  case succ d' =>
    induction c with e he
    case zero =>
      rw [mul_zero] at h
      contradiction
    case succ e' =>
      rw [mul_succ] at h he
      repeat rw [mul_succ] at h
      exact hd h

name: mul_right_eq_self
statement: theorem mul_right_eq_self (a b : MyNat) (ha : a ≠ zero) (h : mul a b = a) : b = one := by
proof:
cases b with
| zero =>
  rw [mul_zero] at h
  contradiction
| succ n =>
  rw [mul_succ] at h
  rw [h] at h
  have : mul a n = zero := by
    rw [← h]
    exact zero_mul a
  have : n = zero := by
    apply le_zero
    use a
    rw [h]
    exact zero_mul a
  rw [this] at h
  rw [one_eq_succ_zero] at h
  exact h
